_comment: Created by ianb on 01/08/2014 12:53:37 using v2.1
title: How has the successful treatment rate of non-opiate drug users changed over time?
analysis_commentary: The number of non-opiate drug users aged between 18 and 75 undergoing successful completion of drug treatment increased between January 2010 and December 2012, rising from 37.5% to 40.2% of all users in treatment. The outcomes of the two treatment groups vary dramatically, with the proportion of users successfully completing drug treatment much lower for users of opiates compared with users of all other drugs. Overall, the number of non-opiate drug users undergoing treatment in England increased from 38,137 people in 2010 to 38,506 people in 2012.
data_source: National Drug Treatment Monitoring System, Public Health Outcomes Framework indicators
